articles.author: MELANIE LIDMAN and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: RE'IM, Israel (AP) — Israelis were holding vigils and somber ceremonies on Monday to mark a year since the Oct. 7, 2023, Hamas attack, the deadliest in the country’s history, which sparked the war in Gaza and scarred Israelis indelibly.
articles.title: Israelis, scarred and battling on multiple fronts, mark a year since Hamas' Oct. 7 attack

articles.author: JOSEPH KRAUSS and SARAH EL DEEB
articles.description: The Gaza Strip is in ruins.There are hills of rubble where apartment blocks stood, and pools of sewage-tainted water spreading disease.
articles.title: Gaza is in ruins after Israel's yearlong offensive. Rebuilding may take decades

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: KFAR AZA, Israel (AP) — On a sun-dappled day in Kibbutz Kfar Aza, Liora Eilon stood at the spot where her son was killed. She stooped to pick a figurine from the pile of belongings scattered around an abandoned home nearby.
articles.title: A year after the Hamas attack shattered this Israeli community, going home still feels impossible

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — A new round of airstrikes hit Beirut suburbs late Sunday as Israel intensified its bombardment of northern Gaza and southern Lebanon in a widening war with Iran-allied militant groups across the region.
articles.title: Israel intensifies bombardment of Gaza and southern Lebanon ahead of Oct. 7 anniversary

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The United States has spent a record of at least $17.9 billion on military aid to Israel since the war in Gaza began and led to escalating conflict around the Middle East, according to a report for Brown University's Costs of War project, released on the anniversary of Hamas’ attacks on Israel.
articles.title: US spends a record $17.9 billion on military aid to Israel since last Oct. 7

articles.author: FARNOUSH AMIRI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. government’s top disaster relief official said Sunday that false claims and conspiracy theories about the federal response to Hurricane Helene — spread most prominently by Donald Trump — are “demoralizing” aid workers and creating fear in people who need recovery assistance.
articles.title: US disaster relief chief blasts false claims about Helene response as a 'truly dangerous narrative'

articles.author: JEFF MARTIN and FREIDA FRISARO
articles.description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Florida (AP) — Florida is gearing up for what could be its biggest evacuation in seven years as Hurricane Milton strengthens over warm waters and heads toward major population centers including Tampa and Orlando.
articles.title: Florida prepares for massive evacuations as Hurricane Milton takes aim at major metro areas

articles.author: JOSH BOAK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris opened a media blitz by the Democratic ticket on Sunday by appearing on the popular “Call Her Daddy” podcast about abortion, sexual abuse and other issues that resonate with women, working in some digs at her GOP opponent along the way.
articles.title: Harris talks abortion and more on 'Call Her Daddy' podcast as Democratic ticket steps up interviews

articles.author: PIERRE-RICHARD LUXAMA and ELÉONORE HUGHES
articles.description: SAINT-MARC, Haiti (AP) — Nearly 6,300 people have fled their homes in the aftermath of an attack in central Haiti by heavily armed gang members that killed at least 70 people, according to the U.N.’s migration agency.
articles.title: Over 6,000 people in Haiti leave their homes after gang attack killed dozens

articles.author: GREG BEACHAM
articles.description: PALM DESERT, Calif. (AP) — LeBron James and his son Bronny made NBA history Sunday night when they played together for the first time during the Los Angeles Lakers ' preseason game against Phoenix.
articles.title: LeBron and son Bronny James play together for the first time in a preseason game for the Lakers
